titleInfo.title: Johnson et al v. Champion, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 25 Motion to Dismiss. Defendants "City of Satsuma Officials" and "City of Satsuma Roads/Zoning Employees" are dismissed, without prejudice to the plaintiffs' ability to seek leave to file a timely second amended complaint asserting claims against additional named defendants. The Satsuma Police Department is dismissed, without prejudice. Signed by Chief Judge William H. Steele on 2/5/2013. copies to parties. (sdb)

titleInfo.title: Johnson et al v. Champion, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Order granting 99 MOTION for Summary Judgment. The Clerk of Court is directed to terminate City of Satsuma as a party defendant. Granting 104 MOTION for Summary Judgment filed by MKH Properties, LLC, Maurice Kirk Harless. All claims and causes of action asserted against those defendants are dismissed with prejudice. Denying 97 MOTION "Leave for a Motion to Determine who among the Parties of this Litigation has the Superior Title to the Property". Granting 105 MOTION for Partial Summary Judgment filed by MKH Properties, LLC, Maurice Kirk Harless. The parties are ordered to attend and participate in good faith an in-person status conference to be scheduled by the Magistrate Judge. The Final Pretrial Conference, jury selection and trial settings are continued until further notice. Signed by Chief Judge William H. Steele on 1/2/2014. copies to parties. (sdb)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:12-cv-00334; Johnson et al v. Champion, et al;

extension.docketText: Order granting 99 MOTION for Summary Judgment. The Clerk of Court is directed to terminate City of Satsuma as a party defendant. Granting 104 MOTION for Summary Judgment filed by MKH Properties, LLC, Maurice Kirk Harless. All claims and causes of action asserted against those defendants are dismissed with prejudice. Denying 97 MOTION "Leave for a Motion to Determine who among the Parties of this Litigation has the Superior Title to the Property". Granting 105 MOTION for Partial Summary Judgment filed by MKH Properties, LLC, Maurice Kirk Harless. The parties are ordered to attend and participate in good faith an in-person status conference to be scheduled by the Magistrate Judge. The Final Pretrial Conference, jury selection and trial settings are continued until further notice. Signed by Chief Judge William H. Steele on 1/2/2014. copies to parties. (sdb)

titleInfo.title: Johnson et al v. Champion, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Order directing plaintiffs by 5/2/2014 to file evidentiary submission re: sanctions. MKH and Harless may file a response by 5/9/2014. Signed by Chief Judge William H. Steele on 4/18/2014. (tgw)

titleInfo.title: Johnson et al v. Champion, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER re: all remaining issues relating to defendants' Motions for Sanctions (docs. 149 & 150). Plaintiffs are ordered to pay M.K. Harless and MKH Properties, LLC, the sum of $72,477.61 to offset attorney's costs and fees & Plaintiffs are enjoined from filing any Action against defendants. Should Plaintiffs wish to initiate a new Action within the scope of this injunction, they must file a proposed complaint in this civil action for pre-filing screening. Signed by Chief Judge William H. Steele on 5/28/2014. (tgw)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:12-cv-00334; Johnson et al v. Champion, et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Southern District of Alabama
extension.docketText: ORDER re: all remaining issues relating to defendants' Motions for Sanctions (docs. 149 & 150). Plaintiffs are ordered to pay M.K. Harless and MKH Properties, LLC, the sum of $72,477.61 to offset attorney's costs and fees & Plaintiffs are enjoined from filing any Action against defendants. Should Plaintiffs wish to initiate a new Action within the scope of this injunction, they must file a proposed complaint in this civil action for pre-filing screening. Signed by Chief Judge William H. Steele on 5/28/2014. (tgw)
